metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2329 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Check_MK before1.2.2p3 and 1.2.3x before 1.2.3i5 allow remote authenticated users toinject arbitrary web script or HTML via the (1) agent string for a check_mkagent, a (2) crafted request to a monitored host, which is not properlyhandled by the logwatch module, or other unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2329` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

check-mk-agent - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-agent-logwatch - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-config-icinga - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-config-nagios3 - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-livestatus - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-multisite - 1.2.2p3-1
check-mk-server - 1.2.2p3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: check-mk package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.2p3-1').
